Title: How to Disable a Nuclear Plant with a Flash Drive | <3 #142 GEMINI
Description: When I'm unable to follow how hacking works, Gemini steps in with a real life example that really does wonders. We dive how the Stuxnet worm scouted, infiltrated and systematically ruined Iranian nuclear facilities.

Title: We Design a Digital Space(ship) that Defies the Laws of Physics | <3 #141 CHATGPT
Description: Chat & I discuss the design of vessel designed to explore the gap between the digital and physical worlds. It's home to the podcast among other things. We then create Bolt.new prompts in order to break ground on it.

Description: Coco started strong but crapped out halfway as we learn about how virtual private servers can level up your web-based creation game.

Description: Utilizing AI to build complex things on the web, that I otherwise couldn't before, really fascinates me. We dive into how that all works at a basic depth.

Title: The State of the Sub-$2K 3D Printing Market & Bambu's Entire Line | <3 #138 GEMINI

Title: In the Chernobyl Control Room | <3 #137 CHATGPT
Description: We explore the modern, prospering Soviet town of Pripyat, Ukraine in April of 1986. Then we enter the control room at reactor 4 of the nuclear plant in the early hours of Sat. April 26th. We observe abnormal activity in a safety test next to the deputy chief engineer Anatoly Dyatlov. We even stick around to mitigate the worst case scenario.

Title: 3 Act Structure & The Piccolo | <3 #136 CHATGPT
Description: In this one we do a quick study of the 3 Act Structure of storytelling and then dive into how it applies to the story we've been working on. We then proceed to ripping the younger daughter's heart out (figuratively) and setting the stage for sleuthing, redemption & revenge.

Title: Traveling Back to The Great Chicago Fire of 1871 | <3 #135 GEMINI
Description: We travel back in time to a dry, windy Sunday October 8th 1871, when the flame from a single lantern decimates the bustling trading hub & ends up paving the way for the world's first skyscrapers.

Title: 2 House Cats Talk Mad Shit on a Zoom Interviewer | <3 #134 CHATGPT
Description: We follow Oscar the housecat into scene 3 of our story as he and his brother Charlie eavesdrop and talk mad shit on the father's zoom interviewer.

Title: The Evolution of Skyscrapers & How We  Build Them | <3 #133 GEMINI
Description: Gemini takes us down the skyscraper rabbit hole starting in 1880's Chicago, 9 years after The Great Chicago Fire. We learn about The Taipei 101's solid steel mass damper, how early elevators were sketch af, and follow Andy the (fictional) ironworker up the nearly-finished Empire State Building as he catches white-hot rivets with a bucket before pounding them into steel beams that remain steadfast 95 years later.

Title: Sorting out Perspectives Within Our Fiction Story | <3 #132 CHATGPT
Description: Chat comes up with an intriguing idea for a 2nd perspective to tell our story from. Then we push into brainstorming about the younger daughter's current life and what scene 3 should be.

Title: The Capabilities of Carol's AI-Powered, Real-Time Intelligence Gathering School Bus | <3 #131 CHATGPT

She uses it to gather real-time intelligence across large swaths of land. Here we see a bit more of what boots on the ground looks like.

Title: When Conscription Becomes Forced Labor | <3 #130 COPILOT/GEMINI
Description: Copilot teaches us about the boundaries that separates conscription, forced labor & slavery. Then it craps out and needs to be relieved by Gemini.

Title: Using Drones, Cameras, & AI to Surveil a Large Area on a Budget | <3 #129 CHATGPT
Description: It honestly isn't prohibitively expensive to establish an AI-supported, real-time intelligence gathering net of drones and cameras. We introduce Carol the freelance frontline journalist and intelligence consultant.

Title: Skip this Episode | <3 #128 GEMINI

At nearly 5 minutes it's easily 2x longer than any other voice statement I've been able to conjure, ever. Felt very empathetic.
